Package gui.DefaultScreen

Class AddressBar

java.lang.Object
gui.DefaultScreen.AddressBar
public class AddressBar
extends java.lang.Object
The class for the address bar, this contains all necessary code for a functioning address bar

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    AddressBar​(DefaultScreen screen)
    constructor for the address bar
    AddressBar​(java.lang.String startAddress, DefaultScreen screen)
    constructor for the address bar

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void draw​(java.awt.Graphics g, int width)
    an updater to redraw the address bar in its current state, this includes text-cursor and selected text
    java.lang.String getAddress()
    gets the current address from the address bar
    void handleKeyEvent​(int id, int keyCode, char keyChar, int modifier)
    handles the key-presses while the address bar is in focus
    void handleMouseEvent​(int id, int x, int y, int clickCount)
    When this is called, a mouse event has happened on the address bar when the address bar is in focus

    checks if the address bar is in focus
    boolean isOnAddressBar​(int X, int Y)
    checks if the given position is on the address bar

  • Constructor Details

    • AddressBar

      public AddressBar​(java.lang.String startAddress, DefaultScreen screen)
      constructor for the address bar
      Parameters:
      startAddress - The address that should be shown on startup of the address bar

    • AddressBar

      public AddressBar​(DefaultScreen screen)
      constructor for the address bar

  • Method Details

    • draw

      public void draw​(java.awt.Graphics g, int width)
      an updater to redraw the address bar in its current state, this includes text-cursor and selected text
      Parameters:
      g - the java drawing help

    • setAddress

      public void setAddress​(java.lang.String aBarText)
      sets the address in the address bar
      Parameters:
      aBarText - the address that will be set

    • getAddress

      public java.lang.String getAddress()
      gets the current address from the address bar
      Returns:
      the address currently in the address bar

    • isOnAddressBar

      public boolean isOnAddressBar​(int X, int Y)
      checks if the given position is on the address bar
      Parameters:
      X - the given x coordinate
      Y - the given y coordinate
      Returns:
      a boolean representing is the position is on this address bar

    • handleMouseEvent

      public void handleMouseEvent​(int id, int x, int y, int clickCount)
      When this is called, a mouse event has happened on the address bar when the address bar is in focus
      Parameters:
      id - The id off the mouse event
      clickCount - The click count off the user post When initially clicking the address bar, an insertion point will be shown ("text cursor") When initially clicking the address bar, all text is selected ( Blue background )

    • handleKeyEvent

      public void handleKeyEvent​(int id, int keyCode, char keyChar, int modifier)
      handles the key-presses while the address bar is in focus
      Parameters:
      id - The id off the pressed button
      keyCode - The keycode for the pressed button
      keyChar - The char that was pressed
      modifier - The modifier on the pressed key

    • isInFocus

      public boolean isInFocus()
      checks if the address bar is in focus
      Returns:
      true if the address bar is in focus, else false

    • setInFocus

      public void setInFocus()
      sets the address bar in focus

    • setOutFocus

      public void setOutFocus()
      sets the address bar out of focus
